metadata.title: CVE-2024-41095 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/nouveau/dispnv04: fix null pointer dereference in nv17_tv_get_ld_modesIn nv17_tv_get_ld_modes(), the return value of drm_mode_duplicate() isassigned to mode, which will lead to a possible NULL pointer dereferenceon failure of drm_mode_duplicate(). Add a check to avoid npd.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-41095` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-195-generic - 5.4.0-195.215
linux-image-5.4.0-195-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-195.215
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-195-generic - 5.4.0-195.215
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-195-lowlatency - 5.4.0-195.215
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1120-kvm - 5.4.0-1120.128
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1132-aws - 5.4.0-1132.142
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1137-azure - 5.4.0-1137.144
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1092-bluefield - 5.4.0-1092.99
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1136-gcp - 5.4.0-1136.145
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1099-gkeop - 5.4.0-1099.103
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1079-ibm - 5.4.0-1079.84
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1131-oracle - 5.4.0-1131.140
No subscription required
